CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 17.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING : Peal Crl.M.C.No.53/2024 2 2024/KERMOI3 ORDER This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of CrP.C. is filed by the sole accused in Crime No.450 of 2023 of Pandalam Police Station, Pathanamthitta District, registered under Sections 323 and 498A of IPC and Section 31(1) of the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005, for quashing Annexure-Al final report in C.C.No.933 of 2023, on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Adoor. 2. The prosecution allegation is that the petitioner, who is the husband of the defacto complainant, subjected her to matrimonial cruelties demanding money and gold. 3. When the matter is taken up for consideration, learned counsel for the petitioner would submit that the dispute stands settled, and he produced Annexure-A2 affidavit of the 3rd respondent, endorsing the settlement, and further stating that, she has no intention to continue with the prosecution. She has no objection in quashing the Rial Crl.M.C.No.53/2024 3 2024/KERMOI3 proceedings in C.C.No.933 of 2023 pending against the petitioner before Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Adoor. 4. Learned Public Prosecutor on __ instructions submitted that the matter has been settled, and he produced the signed statement of the 3rd respondent, to the effect that as the matter is settled, she has no objection in quashing the proceedings in C.C.No.933 of 2023. 5. Since the matter stands settled, no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 6. In the light of the principles laid down by the Apex Court in Gian Singh v. State of Punjab and Another; [(2012) 10 SCC 303)], and State of Madhya Pradesh v. Laxmi Narayan and Others; [(2019) 5 SCC 688], this Court is of the view that the proceedings against the petitioner can be quashed on the basis of settlement. Moreover, the dispute is purely personal in nature, and no public interest is involved in it. | CrL.M.C.No.53/2024 4 2024/KER/M013 In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-Al final report in C.C.No.933 of 2023 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Adoor, stands quashed.
